newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Cosmos rises on higher output prospects.
newsitem.headline: Cosmos rises on higher output prospects.

text.p: Philippine soft drinks manufacturer Cosmos Bottling Corp rose 25 centavos or 6.17 percent to 4.30 pesos by midsession on higher production prospects, brokers said.
"People are buying Cosmos due to its cheap price-earnings ratio, especially after it bought another plant," Noel Reyes, research head of Dharmala Securities, said.
The company recently bought the production plant of RC Cola in Laguna, south of Manila. At present, Cosmos has only one plant operating in Bulacan, north of Manila.
